channel.title: Whats the best base for a newbie?
channel.description: Ok, i need something new, [PI] has pissed me off for the last time.. its too advanced for me, and I don't know which new base I should use..

item.title: Whats the best base for a newbie?
item.dc:creator: @jwags jwags
item.description:
@jwags wrote:

ok download any old base, then start coding it, (keep it offline) google tut’s on how to do certain things, of you can even use the tutorials on this site. there are plenty of good ones. and as you work you will learn and remember how to do things. be4 i started rsps i pretty much new shit about java, i knew arrays and other simple things, else, if else if, i knew like maybe one import. now i know how to fuckin code a game, i rule =D

Read full topic
item.source: Whats the best base for a newbie?

item.title: Whats the best base for a newbie?
item.dc:creator: @tyyy9 tyyy9
item.description:
@tyyy9 wrote:

zzjimmy:

ummmm do u want a blank base or…?

Yes, Im not good enough to where I can write my own, but something sorta basic, to where it’s not already edited to death, get what I’m saying?

Read full topic
item.source: Whats the best base for a newbie?

item.title: Whats the best base for a newbie?
item.dc:creator: @chassy13 Chassy13
item.description:
@chassy13 wrote:

Although highly unstable, I learned off of sources like PimpScape, Czar, Allstar, etc. (which is about all that was available during the time I started programming RSPS). Most things are packed into a single class so you learn the basics and also have room to improve and try new things. I learned everything I know about Java (a decent amount, but not too much…I just suck at efficiency) and still have plenty of things to try and learn using an Allstar source.

Read full topic
item.source: Whats the best base for a newbie?

item.title: Whats the best base for a newbie?
item.dc:creator: @d34th0wnsu d34th0wnsu
item.description:
@d34th0wnsu wrote:

Hyperion is ridiculously hard to code. Very confusing. I suggest coding with OverloadX, ErasedPkz, Torvapkz; however, they are all similar to PI. But different.

Read full topic

item.title: Whats the best base for a newbie?
item.dc:creator: @tyyy9 tyyy9
item.description:
@tyyy9 wrote:

I’ve studied much java, and by much i mean as much as I can learn from a book, any more instruction would take a real instructor because you can only learn so much from a book. I just don’t understand the coding written in a base, it confuses me with delta coding and [PI] all being different… I just need a new base because mine sucks…

Read full topic

item.title: Whats the best base for a newbie?
item.dc:creator: @hadesflames hadesflames
item.description:
@hadesflames wrote:

How about you pick up a book and learn Java for real instead. Then take your pick between any source. They’re all simple, including PI…
